arts.ttl: Ruud van Nistelrooy explains Leicester City 'non-negotiables' after dream start
arts.sum: Leicester City boss Ruud van Nistelrooy insisted the work rate and attitude displayed by his players in the 3-1 win over West Ham are "non-negotiable" if they are to remain in the Premier League this season. After the win, Van Nistelrooy was asked about the importance of the fans in City's task of remaining in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: 'I think': Chris Sutton says whether West Ham should sack Julen Lopetegui after Leicester City defeat
Jamie Vardy's immediate reaction after West Ham fans mock wife Rebekah speaks volumes
arts.sum: West Ham's travelling supporters launched into a chant about Jamie Vardy's wife Rebekah during their match at Leicester but the Foxes striker had a perfect response

arts.ttl: 'Strange' - Kevin Nolan hits out at Lopetegui decision in West Ham v Leicester
arts.sum: Kevin Nolan hit out at the decision by Julen Lopetegui to substitute Danny Ings at halftime and move Jarrod Bowen as West Ham lost 3-1... The post 'Strange' - Kevin Nolan hits out at Lopetegui decision in West Ham v Leicester appeared first on West Ham Zone.

arts.ttl: Ruud van Nistelrooy refuses to overlook Leicester City fact despite debut victory
arts.sum: While Van Nistelrooy saw plenty of the characteristics he wanted from his team, he admitted the defensive structure and pressing were not quite right, leading to West Ham’s chances. Ruud van Nistelrooy refused to get carried away with his debut victory as Leicester City manager, the Dutchman quick to point out “the fact” of West Ham’s dominance.

arts.ttl: “Perfect fit” | Controversial manager could just be the man West Ham need
arts.sum: West Ham eye Portuguese manager to replace Julen Lopetegui. Things have gone from bad to worse for Julen Lopetegui this week. A 5-2 thrashing against Arsenal undone all the work his side put in against Newcastle, and a shock defeat at Leicester may just be the catalyst to his downfall. West Ham have been poor... arts.sum: West Ham’s 3-1 defeat should be the final nail in the coffin for Julen Lopetegui, but will it be? After their 5-2 loss to Arsenal, West Ham desperately needed to bounce back against Leicester. Unfortunately, this wasn’t the case. arts.ttl: Smiling Van Nistelrooy brings belief back to Leicester
arts.sum: His Leicester side had to ride their luck at times against West Ham, but victory for a smiling Ruud van Nistelrooy is already giving Foxes fans their "belief" back.

arts.ttl: Van Nistelrooy's effect on Leicester highlights depth of Lopetegui's plight | Ben Fisher
arts.athr: Ben Fisher at the King Power Stadium
arts.sum: New manager’s instant connection with fans stood in stark contrast to the forlorn, isolated figure in West Ham’s dugout Ninety-eight seconds. That was all that was required for Ruud van Nistelrooy’s Leicester City reign to get up and running. Jamie Vardy’s opener offered an early snapshot of Leicester in Van Nistelrooy’s image, too. Victor Kristiansen, hugging the left touchline, squared the ball to Bilal El Khannouss, who freed Leicester’s No 9, head down, open for business in the left channel. Vardy, wearing garish pink boots, stroked a timeless right-foot finish into the far corner. After a VAR check, he clinked into celebration mode, chuntering towards the away fans giving him grief. Even before Patson Daka made it 3-0 with stoppage time looming, the same supporters switched their attention to their manager. “You’re getting sacked in the morning,” came the chant. Julen Lopetegui, ashen-faced at the final whistle, will do well to survive this grisly defeat. Lopetegui combed his hand through his hair, his whirring mind in overdrive, under pressure. Welcome back to the brutal world of frontline management, Ruud. Continue reading...
